text: It is not sufficient to see and to know the beauty of a work. We must feel and be affected by it.
author: Voltaire

text: Beauty is mysterious as well as terrible. God and devil are fighting there, and the battlefield is the heart of man.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

text: Enlightened leadership is spiritual if we understand spirituality not as some kind of religious dogma or ideology but as the domain of awareness where we experience values like truth, goodness, beauty, love and compassion, and also intuition, creativity, insight and focused attention.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: Anything in any way beautiful derives its beauty from itself and asks nothing beyond itself. Praise is no part of it, for nothing is made worse or better by praise.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.
author: Friedrich Schiller
